intro: Polyscias tripinnata, commonly known as the three-part fern or the tropical nettle, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with three primary leaflets, each further divided into smaller segments, giving it a feathery appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. Polyscias tripinnata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
